page.title: 12S.CROYDON BUS GARAGE
page.content: On the first day of May we went to South Croydon bus garage.You have to be at least twenty_one to be a bus driver.In the morning the bus driver signs on.At lunch time the mechanics change the route and bus numbers.After a day's work the drivers and the conductors give in all their money and if they have not got enough it has to come from their own pockets. In 1941 a bomb dropped on the garage,destroying 180 buses.In 1952 it was reopened.Every bus has T.C. on it after the original owner Thomas Tilling of Croydon.The buses are now run by London Regional Transport.They have four lady drivers,one roofless bus and a total of 124 buses at the garage.There is a canteen for the staff.
